***Next Election will be November 3, 2026 for the election of 3 at large positions for Alderman.***

The City of Weston Lakes is a general law type b city as described in Texas Local Government Code. Our municipal elections are held on election day in November each year. The city residents elect a Mayor and 5 Alderman (council members) for 2 year terms. They are staggered, with Mayor and 2 Alderman in uneven years and the remaining 3 Alderman in even years.

If you wish to run for City Government, you will need to follow the deadlines outlined in the appropriate election year. Mid-July, you can pick up a “Candidate Packet” with an application for a place on the ballot at the Weston Lakes City offices during regular office hours (Monday-Wednesday 11 a.m. – 5 p.m.)

Applications must be filed with the City Secretary. Write-in candidates may declare intent to run. (In order to be a write-in candidate one must have registered in the same way as regular candidates with the exception of paying a filing fee and having extra days to file the paperwork. The name must appear on the official ballot.)

To be eligible for municipal office, a candidate must be a US citizen, 18 years of age or older, have not been found mentally incompetent or convicted of a felony and have resided continuously in the state for 12 months and in the city for 6 months preceding the deadline for filing.

Please be sure you are registered at your present address in order to vote in elections.

If you have any questions, you can contact the city administrator/secretary at 281-533-0907.

The November Election has been cancelled due to candidates running unopposed. Please see certification and Order of Cancellation below. Mayor Bob Wall, Mayor Pro Tem Linda Harnist and Alderman Rhea Ragle will be sworn in at the November City Council meeting.

**[Cancellation of Election](https://westonlakestexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/Cancellation-of-Election-for-November-4-2025.pdf)
and
[Certification of Candidates Running Unopposed](https://westonlakestexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/Certification-of-unopposed-Candidates-2025-Signed.pdf)**

New! See
**[Advisory: Senate Bill 2753](https://westonlakestexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/ADV2025-10-Bill-Summary-of-SB-2753.pdf)**

May 2025
--------

January 28th, 2025 the City Council voted to approve
[Ordinance 03-2025](https://westonlakestexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Ord-03-2025.pdf)
.

This ordinance calls for a special election to take place on the May 3, 2025 Uniform Election Date for the qualified voters of the City of Weston Lakes to consider “Proposition A”. The City is currently seeking to conduct a Joint Election with the County to provide election services, this will allow the Weston Lakes voters to vote on this proposition at any Fort Bend County polling location.

**CITY OF WESTON LAKES SALES AND USE TAX ELECTION**

**The adoption of an additional sales and use tax within the city at the rate of two percent (2%).**

More information can be found at:
<https://westonlakestexas.gov/proposition-a-a-general-revenue-sales-and-use-tax-in-weston-lakes/>

November 2025
-------------

On November 4, 2025, the City of Weston Lakes will go to the polls to elect the positions of Mayor and two (2) Council Members for a two (2) year term. If you wish to run for these positions (beginning July 16, 2025), you can find a “Candidate Packet” with an application for a place on the ballot, on the City of Weston Lakes website at, westonlakestexas.gov, or pick up a packet at the Weston Lakes City office at 8045 FM 359, Fulshear, TX. 77441, during regular office hours (Monday & Wednesday 11 a.m.–5 p.m.).

**[Candidate Packet HERE](https://westonlakestexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/2025-General-Election-Candidate-Packet.pdf)**

Applications must be filed with the City Secretary by 5 p.m. on August 18, 2025.

Write-in candidates may declare between July 20, 2025 and August 23, 2025 by 5 p.m. (In order to be a write-in candidate one must have registered in the same way as regular candidates with the exception of paying a filing fee and having extra days to file the paperwork. The name must appear on the official ballot.)

The City of Weston Lakes does not charge a filing fee.

To be eligible for municipal office, a candidate must be a US citizen, 18 years of age or older, have not been found mentally incompetent or convicted of a felony and have resided continuously in the state for 12 months and in the city for 6 months preceding the deadline for filing.

Please be sure you are registered at your present address in order to vote in this election. The last day to register to vote in time for the municipal election is October 6, 2025.

El 28 de enero de 2025, el Concejo Municipal votó para aprobar la Ordenanza 03-2025.

Esta ordenanza convoca a una elección especial que tendrá lugar el 3 de mayo de 2025, Fecha Uniforme de Elecciones, para que los votantes calificados de la Ciudad de Weston Lakes consideren la “Propuesta A”. Actualmente, la Ciudad está tratando de realizar una Elección Conjunta con el Condado para prestar servicios electorales, lo que permitirá a los votantes de Weston Lakes votar sobre esta proposición en cualquier centro de votación del Condado de Fort Bend.

**CITY OF WESTON LAKES SALES AND USE TAX ELECTION**

**The adoption of an additional sales and use tax within the city at the rate of two percent (2%).**

Más información se puede encontrar en:
<https://westonlakestexas.gov/proposition-a-a-general-revenue-sales-and-use-tax-in-weston-lakes/>

El 4 de noviembre de 2025, la Ciudad de Weston Lakes irá a las urnas para elegir los cargos de Alcalde y dos (2) Concejales por un período de dos (2) años. Si desea postularse para estos cargos (a partir del 16 de Julio de 2025), puede encontrar un “Paquete para candidatos” con una solicitud para un lugar en la boleta electoral, en el sitio web de la Ciudad de Weston Lakes en, westonlakestexas.gov, o recoger un paquete en la oficina de la Ciudad de Weston Lakes en 8045 FM 359, Fulshear, TX. 77441, en horario de oficina (lunes y miércoles de 11 a.m. a 5 p.m.).

Los candidatos por escrito pueden declararse entre el 20 de julio de 2025 y el 23 de agosto de 2025 antes de las 17.00 horas. (Para ser candidato por escrito hay que haberse inscrito de la misma forma que los candidatos regulares, con la excepción de pagar una tasa de inscripción y disponer de días adicionales para presentar la documentación. El nombre debe aparecer en la papeleta oficial).  La ciudad de Weston Lakes no cobra tasa de presentación.

Para ser elegible para un cargo municipal, un candidato debe ser ciudadano de los Estados Unidos, mayor de 18 años, no haber sido declarado mentalmente incompetente ni condenado por un delito grave y haber residido continuamente en el estado durante 12 meses y en la ciudad durante los 6 meses anteriores a la fecha límite de presentación.
